subject: Creativity
title: Show, Don't Tell: Writing's Golden Rule
description: A quick win: understand Show, Don't Tell: Writing's Golden Rule.

hook.text: 'She was sad' is telling. 'She stared at the untouched cake, pressing her thumb into the frosting' is showing.

buildup.text: Chekhov wrote: 'Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass.

discovery.text: Showing activates the reader's imagination. Telling bypasses it.

twist.text: But great writers break this rule constantly. 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times' ‚Äî pure telling.

climax.text: The real rule: show emotions, tell logistics. Nobody needs to 'experience' a character driving to the airport.

punchline.text: Show when it matters. Tell when it doesn't. That's the actual rule.

quiz.question: Which famous author said 'show me the glint of light on broken glass'?
